alert.note: Alert for Bear Lake (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 28 at 10:57AM MDT until further notice by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is occurring. * WHERE...Bear Lake County in southeast Idaho. * WHEN...Until 300 PM MDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Streams and creeks running high. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1047 AM MDT, emergency management reported flooding of fields is occurring. Warming temperatures over the next several days could further increase snowmelt and runoff and lead to additional impacts. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Montpelier, Bear Lake Idaho Portion, Georgetown, Saint Charles, Dingle, Paris, Bloomington, Ovid, Bern, Bennington, Liberty, Geneva Summit, Emmigrant Summit, Border Summit, Georgetown Summit, Pegram, Fish Haven, Minnetonka Cave and Geneva. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to the National Weather Service office in Pocatello via phone, email, or social media, when you can do so safely.
